For the sake of the child (and the mother), the mother's [[Interpretation of an SD-236 serology result|HIV status]] should be known. Screening should be offered systematically at the beginning of pregnancy (at the time of notification), even if it is not compulsory.

question.title: When should screening for HIV be offered to a pregnant woman?
question.description: Knowing the methods of maternal screening

option_a.title: Immediately after notification of HIV status
option_a.description: Offering screening at the beginning of pregnancy (at the time of notification)

option_b.title: Only after the first trimester
option_b.description: Screening should be offered systematically at the beginning of pregnancy (at the time of notification)

option_c.title: After the first trimester
option_c.description: Offering screening at the beginning of pregnancy (at the time of notification)

option_d.title: Only after the first trimester
option_d.description: Screening should be offered systematically at the beginning of pregnancy (at the time of notification)

correct_option.title: Immediately after notification of HIV status
correct_option.description: Offering screening at the beginning of pregnancy (at the time of notification)
